Those platforms all offer a tangible service that is being used by millions of real world users, unlike Bitcoin. Furthermore, they have since become more energy efficient through centralization. Decentralized PoW can't do that.

*This doesn't imply I hate Bitcoin or Proof of Work coins, by the way - it's just important the industry reflects on itself and is critical of how many ice caps are worth melting for digital kittens. Don't bury your head in the sand simply because you hold some cryptocurrency.

Yes. You have to move your money into another asset class to increase purchasing power. Bitcoin supply is fixed so as long as the utility increases over the long term it rewards the Bitcoin saver increasing their purchasing power for long term savers. It’s deflationary design.
